00066 /*------------------------------------------------------
00067   int CCmdLine::SplitLine(int argc, char **argv)
00068 
00069   parse the command line into switches and arguments
00070 
00071   returns number of switches found
00072 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 int CCmdLine::SplitLine(int argc, char **argv)
00074 {
00075         clear();
00076 
00077         StringType curParam; // current argv[x]
00078 
00079         // skip the exe name (start with i = 1)
00080         for (int i = 1; i < argc; i++)
00081         {
00082                 // if it's a switch, start a new CCmdLine
00083                 if (IsSwitch(argv[i]))
00084                 {
00085                         curParam = argv[i];
00086 
00087                         StringType arg;
00088 
00089                         // look at next input string to see if it's a switch or an argument
00090                         if (i + 1 < argc)
00091                         {
00092                                 if (!IsSwitch(argv[i + 1]))
00093                                 {
00094                                         // it's an argument, not a switch
00095                                         arg = argv[i + 1];
00096 
00097                                         // skip to next
00098                                         i++;
00099                                 }
00100                                 else
00101                                 {
00102                                         arg = "";
00103                                 }
00104                         }
00105 
00106                         // add it
00107                         CCmdParam cmd;
00108 
00109                         // only add non-empty args
00110                         if (arg != "")
00111                         {
00112                                 cmd.m_strings.push_back(arg);
00113                         }
00114 
00115                         // add the CCmdParam to 'this'
00116                         std::pair<CCmdLine::iterator, bool> res = insert(CCmdLine::value_type(curParam, cmd));
00117 
00118                 }
00119                 else
00120                 {
00121                         // it's not a new switch, so it must be more stuff for the last switch
00122 
00123                         // ...let's add it
00124                         CCmdLine::iterator theIterator;
00125 
00126                         // get an iterator for the current param
00127                         theIterator = find(curParam);
00128                         if (theIterator!=end())
00129                         {
00130                                 (*theIterator).second.m_strings.push_back(argv[i]);
00131                         }
00132                         else
00133                         {
00134                                 // ??
00135                         }
00136                 }
00137         }
00138 
00139         return (int) size();
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*------------------------------------------------------
00143 
00144    protected member function
00145    test a parameter to see if it's a switch :
00146 
00147    switches are of the form : -x
00148    where 'x' is one or more characters.
00149    the first character of a switch must be non-numeric!
00150 
00151 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00152 
00153 bool CCmdLine::IsSwitch(const char *pParam)
00154 {
00155    if (pParam==NULL)
00156       return false;
00157 
00158    // switches must non-empty
00159    // must have at least one character after the '-'
00160    int len = (int) strlen(pParam);
00161    if (len <= 1)
00162    {
00163       return false;
00164    }
00165 
00166    // switches always start with '-'
00167    if (pParam[0]=='-')
00168    {
00169       // allow negative numbers as arguments.
00170       // ie., don't count them as switches
00171       return (!isdigit(pParam[1]));
00172    }
00173    else
00174    {
00175       return false;
00176    }
00177 }
00178 
00179 /*------------------------------------------------------
00180    bool CCmdLine::HasSwitch(const char *pSwitch)
00181 
00182    was the switch found on the command line ?
00183 
00184    ex. if the command line is : app.exe -a p1 p2 p3 -b p4 -c -d p5
00185 
00186    call                          return
00187    ----                          ------
00188    cmdLine.HasSwitch("-a")       true
00189    cmdLine.HasSwitch("-z")       false
00190 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00191 
00192 bool CCmdLine::HasSwitch(const char *pSwitch)
00193 {
00194         CCmdLine::iterator theIterator;
00195         theIterator = find(pSwitch);
00196         return (theIterator!=end());
00197 }
00198 
00199 /*------------------------------------------------------
00200 
00201    StringType CCmdLine::GetSafeArgument(const char *pSwitch, int iIdx, const char *pDefault)
00202 
00203    fetch an argument associated with a switch . if the parameter at
00204    index iIdx is not found, this will return the default that you
00205    provide.
00206 
00207    example :
00208   
00209    command line is : app.exe -a p1 p2 p3 -b p4 -c -d p5
00210 
00211    call                                      return
00212    ----                                      ------
00213    cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-a", 0, "zz")    p1
00214    cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-a", 1, "zz")    p2
00215    cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-b", 0, "zz")    p4
00216    cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-b", 1, "zz")    zz
00217 
00218 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00219 
00220 StringType CCmdLine::GetSafeArgument(const char *pSwitch, int iIdx, const char *pDefault)
00221 {
00222    StringType sRet;
00223    
00224    if (pDefault!=NULL)
00225       sRet = pDefault;
00226 
00227    try
00228    {
00229       sRet = GetArgument(pSwitch, iIdx);
00230    }
00231    catch (...)
00232    {
00233    }
00234 
00235    return sRet;
00236 }
00237 
00238 /*------------------------------------------------------
00239 
00240    StringType CCmdLine::GetArgument(const char *pSwitch, int iIdx)
00241 
00242    fetch a argument associated with a switch. throws an exception 
00243    of (int)0, if the parameter at index iIdx is not found.
00244 
00245    example :
00246   
00247    command line is : app.exe -a p1 p2 p3 -b p4 -c -d p5
00248 
00249    call                             return
00250    ----                             ------
00251    cmdLine.GetArgument("-a", 0)     p1
00252    cmdLine.GetArgument("-b", 1)     throws (int)0, returns an empty string
00253 
00254 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00255 
00256 StringType CCmdLine::GetArgument(const char *pSwitch, int iIdx)
00257 {
00258    if (HasSwitch(pSwitch))
00259    {
00260            CCmdLine::iterator theIterator;
00261 
00262       theIterator = find(pSwitch);
00263            if (theIterator!=end())
00264       {
00265          if ((int)(*theIterator).second.m_strings.size() > iIdx)
00266          {
00267             return (*theIterator).second.m_strings[iIdx];
00268          }
00269       }
00270    }
00271 
00272    throw (int)0;
00273 
00274    return "";
00275 }
00276 
00277 /*------------------------------------------------------
00278    int CCmdLine::GetArgumentCount(const char *pSwitch)
00279 
00280    returns the number of arguments found for a given switch.
00281 
00282    returns -1 if the switch was not found
00283 
00284 ------------------------------------------------------*/
00285 
00286 int CCmdLine::GetArgumentCount(const char *pSwitch)
00287 {
00288    int iArgumentCount = -1;
00289 
00290    if (HasSwitch(pSwitch))
00291    {
00292            CCmdLine::iterator theIterator;
00293 
00294       theIterator = find(pSwitch);
00295            if (theIterator!=end())
00296       {
00297          iArgumentCount = (int)(*theIterator).second.m_strings.size();
00298       }
00299    }
00300 
00301    return iArgumentCount;
00302 }
